comment._content: The women in these portraits are gorgeous - and I think it is because they are, and look, so real. Lovely! Thanks for all your comments :)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Hang on... (Drum roll please) I think its Miss Phyllis Baker of Drummoyne! On her quest for film stardom!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I missed the drum roll, so you'll have to do it again! Well done!!! Great find! See it's easy!...or, maybe once you've worked out who they are it's easy(!) Just on a quick look around, it might be possible to dig up quite a bit on her...though I'd say there aren't too many photos of her out there. I'm convinced that more of these Hall portraits will be cracked (maybe not the right word) as other newspapers are digitised...particularly the tabloids and lower brow newspapers... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article129075854 1927 Evening News item and pic nla.gov.au/nla.news-article22180479 1933 Brisbane Courier item and pic nla.gov.au/nla.news-article32901672 1935 West Australian item and pic nla.gov.au/nla.news-article117690636 the 1927 finalists...includes Jessica Harcourt, who was a JC Williamson star...she also appeared in several Australian movies, For the Term of His Natural Life and a couple of others... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article117690637 and the NSW winner was... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article129077651 Gawd! the national finalists! My grandmother never told me that this sort of stuff went on in the 1920s! ...three down...how many to go? PS it's a pity the pics in the Evening News aren't crash hot...so many of the 'Film Star Quest' pics are real duds...they could be anyone!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Beautiful portraits - I'll double check our Hall collection & see if any match up! Phyllis was in the 1933 movie 'Harmony Row', I couldn't find any clips with her in it but ASO have a synopsis: aso.gov.au/titles/features/harmony-row/
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] She is in one of the clips - along with child star Bill Kerr: aso.gov.au/titles/features/harmony-row/clip2/ Love the over-acting in these old films!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
